link.synopsis: After her aunt and uncle perish in a boating mishap, Bridget Love returns to her island home to take the reins at Love Wine Corp. But she soon learns that her stewardship depends on following an unusual family custom to meet her responsibilities -- or else Bridget's eager, sexually unbridled cousin will gain control. Tara Goudreau, Robert Andrew, John DeToro, Daneen Boone and Claude McDonald star in this romantic comedy helmed by Mark McNabb.

link.synopsis: A comic genius, writer, musician and environmental activist, Spike Milligan is perhaps best known as the creator of the British radio comedy "The Goon Show." Yet all his talent couldn't counter the debilitating effects of Milligan's longtime struggle with bipolar disorder. This incisive look back at his life features Milligan's home movies and interviews with his family, friends and contemporaries, including Eddie Izzard and Michael Palin.

link.synopsis: Dennis Palazzolo stars in this outrageous horror comedy helmed by first-time director Aiden Dillard. A quartet of pretty Southern belles gets more than they bargained for when they head for Meatweed Manor, a surreal plantation where an imaginative clan of farmers cultivates some unusual tobacco. It seems the potent weed drives men loco and turns ladies into hot-blooded honeys thanks to a secret ingredient: human flesh.

link.synopsis: Featuring the avant-garde vision of cult filmmaker Giuseppe Andrews, this disturbing (or perhaps disturbed) Troma comedy includes teddy bears in compromising positions, sacrilegious images of God and a deceased pig named Maurice who can't stop smoking. Dark, funny and outright shocking, this series of non sequitur scenes -- filmed on a handheld digital camera -- is an experimental masterpiece not for the faint of heart.

link.synopsis: This poignant British comedy follows six friends who've played on the same London football team since they were children. And although they've known each other for 20 years, the complex issues they now face in adulthood -- including romantic woes, coming out of the closet and dealing with death --  test their close bonds. The smart and sexy film stars a host of up-and-coming British talent, including Dougray Scott, Emilia Fox and Jimi Mistry.

The Man You Had in Mind

link.synopsis: In the tradition of Little Shop of Horrors, this erotically charged, campy comedy tells the story of timid Henry Fudd (Buck Kartalian), a peeping tom who lives with his mother. Lonely and frustrated, Fudd purchases a plant after it whispers to him in a sexy female voice. He soon realizes that the lascivious plant loves humans -- for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Classic vixen Rene Bond appears as a particularly mouth-watering meal.

link.synopsis: Take your wedding -- the landmark event that's supposed to be the most wonderful day of your life -- and imagine that everything's gone wrong. That's exactly what happens in this zany Polish comedy, which takes the concept of etiquette to a whole new extreme. Between overflowing toilets, dead grandfathers and wedding food that even the dog won't touch, a harried husband- and wife-to-be weather a cold, hard dose of reality.

link.synopsis: Its title translating to "Our Folks," this slapstick comedy examines what happens when mortal enemies become neighbors. After relocating to western Poland at the end of World War II, feuding peasant families discover that fate has dealt them a blow: They've settled on two different farms that just so happen to share a border. But the fact that their children don't seem to mind is a troubling development for the quarreling parents.

link.synopsis: The second part of this epic World War II comedy follows the misadventures of Polish Pvt. Franek Dolas (Marian Kociniak), who finds his ship under attack by a Nazi U-boat. After being saved by the French, it's on to the Foreign Legion in Syria before he's captured by the British and liberated by the Italians, who mistake him for an English spy. His only hope now is to dress up as a nurse and take a group of injured soldiers back to Italy.

link.synopsis: The third installment of this epic World War II comedy finds Polish Pvt. Franek Dolas (Marian Kociniak) posing as a nurse to help a group of injured Italian soldiers get back to their native land. But when their party is captured by Germans, who mistake Dolas for a Nazi deserter and promptly send him to the eastern front, it's not such a bad thing, really. After all, now he finally has a chance to get back home!

link.synopsis: Konrad and Dastin have always had trouble accepting the realities of life, preferring to spend their time as aimless slackers. But now that they're broke, they'll resort to anything to stay afloat. Opening an energy-therapeutic emergency unit, they take in a roster of quirky clients, most of whom have no idea what they're getting themselves into. Wojciech Wojcik directs this classic Polish comedy starring Robert Zoledziewski and Jacek Borusinski.

link.synopsis: From the moment Tommy Linklater (Nicolas Wright) enters the hallowed halls of Hatley High, the 18-year-old chess prodigy is a sought-after commodity. After all, his skills are perfect for Hatley's championship chess team, the Knights. With one eye on pretty cheerleader Hyacinthe Marquez (Rachelle Lefevre) and the other on an upcoming match against a formidable Russian foe, Tommy plots a winning strategy in this offbeat comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Hardy Boys Nancy Drew Mysteries
When Zachary Beaver Came to Town

link.synopsis: After four long years in college, childhood friends Miller (Joe Cobden), Stefanie (Karen Cliche) and Charlie (Michael Rubenfeld) are at last ready to graduate in this incisive comedy. But for these slackers -- who are accustomed to conducting "board meetings" by the pool -- the prospect of growing up is endlessly unappealing. Though they try to cling to their devil-may-care way of life, they soon discover they can't avoid adulthood.

link.synopsis: In this all-black double bill, Look-Out Sister stars bandleader Louis Jordan as an exhausted musician who checks into a hospital for a rest. After meeting a young patient who needs fresh air and sunshine, Jordan fantasizes about being a cowhand at a therapeutic ranch where boys can grow up in a healthy environment. And in the comedy Big Timers, a woman pretends to be rich to impress her daughter's wealthy fiancée.  Stepin Fetchit co-stars.

link.synopsis: When Margie Blake (Marjorie Woodworth), who dreams of marriage and the patter of little feet, gets a flat tire, a career bachelor, Tom Wilson (Tom Brown), stops to lend a hand. They instantly clash, but after a passing Oklahoma oilman (Slim Summerville) mistakes them for a married couple, rents them a honeymoon suite at Niagara Falls and locks them in their room, they're in for a long night! Also included is a bonus comedy short, "Dear! Deer!"

link.synopsis: Robert Altman helms this winning romantic comedy about an uptight bachelor (Paul Dooley) who tries his luck with a computer dating service. He gets matched up with his polar opposite -- a singer (Marta Heflin) who often gigs with her rock group "family" -- much to the chagrin of his domineering father (Titos Vandis). The antics of these dysfunctional characters make for a laughable, and relatable, experience.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Helmed by Brian Cavallaro, this indie caper comedy stars Todd Lawhorne as Daulton Monroe, who's in the unusual business of getting students booted out of school (for the right price, of course). But events start to spin out of control when his new ladylove -- a lounge singer, barkeep and reporter -- gets too inquisitive, and Daulton's lucrative operation ends up at risk. Nicole Henry, Don Fowler and Jason Flora co-star.

link.synopsis: In this entertaining comedy, frustrated scribe Alec Thames (Chris Sparling), exhausted by an endless search for individuality, announces to his unstable family that he'll kill himself on his 25th birthday. As the momentous day nears, however, Alec finds love and hope -- but fears his family will see him as a flop if he doesn't go through with his suicidal plans. The supporting cast includes Terri Lynn Harris, Angeline Holmes and Heath Centazzo.
link.title: synopsis
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants

link.synopsis: A ragtag soccer team from a small Mexican village goes for the gold in this uplifting family comedy. Grizzled janitor-turned-coach Don Pepe (Hector Suarez) knows his team has what it takes to make it to the championships in Mexico City and bring fame to San Francisco del Monte, but he faces an uphill battle as he tries to mold the young rookies into supreme soccer players. Lumi Cavazos, Luis Felipe Tovar and Plutarco Haza co-star.

link.synopsis: A tightly wound technician at an insemination clinic creates a conflict of interest of absurd proportions when falls for a free-spirited client who's acting as a surrogate for her infertile sister. Without telling a soul -- not even Ariadna (Leticia Dolera), the woman he's impregnating -- lovesick hospital worker Serafín (Ernesto Alterio) uses his semen in the procedure, leading to hilarious complications in this delightful romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Faced with his lover's infidelity, photographer Yen-Wai (Hee-seon Kim) tracks down zoo veterinarian Man-Kwai (Dong-Kun Jang) to tell her that her boyfriend is sleeping with Yen-Wai's girlfriend in this charming romantic comedy. The two strangers get to know each other well as they plan to avenge the betrayal, and soon begin to fall for each other. But will they be able to let go of their anger and embrace these new feelings?

link.synopsis: Three disabled friends fall head over heels for the same mysterious woman in this risqué romantic comedy. Sightless Tirupati (Prabhu Deva), deaf Badrachalam (Raju Sundaram) and mute Sreesailam (Nagendra Prasad) are close chums, but everything changes when the enigmatic Narmada (Jyothika) enters the picture and steals their hearts. Each man tries to win her hand -- never suspecting that Narmada has a hidden agenda.

I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: A marriage broker inadvertently sends photos of the same girl to two sets of matrimonial-minded parents, leading to humorous results in this comedy of errors. The parents believe Kavitha is an ideal match for their respective sons: Saravanan (Prashanth), the child of an intercaste couple, and Aavudayappan (Livingston). But Aavudayappan is left empty-handed when love blooms between Saravanan and Kavitha -- till her caste-snob grandfather objects.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Comedienne Caroline Rhea lights up the stage with her sassy brand of stand-up humor in this HBO comedy performance. Graced with a sparkling personality and wholesome look that belie a wacky -- and wicked -- wit, Rhea is perhaps best known for her role on "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch" and for her turn as the hostess of "The Biggest Loser." Here, she delights the audience with her fresh and spontaneous routine, a hilarious blend of sugar and spice.

Mike Oettle, Jason Loftin and Idan Flasterstein co-star in this independent sci-fi comedy.

link.synopsis: In this offbeat comedy, debt-ridden, down-on-his-luck discouraged poet -- and incorrigible ladies' man -- Samson Shillitoe (Sean Connery) can't seem to muster the inspiration to complete his masterpiece. Worried that his frustration will soon get the better of him, live-in friend Rhoda (Joanne Woodward) urges him to see a psychiatrist who specializes in writer's block. But in a mad world, the cure just may do more harm than good!

When Tod helps Janie get into a Broadway show helmed by Patch Gallagher (Clark Gable), she's convinced this is her chance to win Patch's heart. The two Texan beauties come up with a foolproof scheme to land a Miami millionaire, but in the end, they discover that true love is as unpredictable as the alligators in Florida's swamps. Charlotte Greenwood, Don Ameche and Robert Cummings co-star.

When the leader of a lesbian separatist group dies in jail, her death spurs an uprising that turns the country upside down. Part fantasy, part comedy and part serious social commentary, this new age chick flick has it all: a female DJ who narrates the action, a feminist rock soundtrack and more.

link.synopsis: Fearing he's just one plate of linguini away from a heart attack, overweight bachelor Dominick DiNapoli tries to shed a few pounds and ends up gaining the love of a good woman in this touching romantic comedy.

In 14 complete shows, juicy watermelon pulp flies high as goofy Gallagher showers audiences with a healthy alternative to buttered popcorn. Comedy concerts include ""Mad as Hell," "Two Real," "Stuck in the '60s," "The Maddest," "Melon Crazy" and more.

link.synopsis: This hilarious comedy sports outrageous sketches from the original eight who made a name for themselves on the Fuse Network with such shows as "Beer" and "Gigolo." Beer: The Movie takes pity on the tone-deaf wannabe rock musicians out there who still try to land their dream girl. Grab a brewski and watch as Robb Ackermann, Nick Corrado and the others perform their very best. You'll laugh, you'll feel good, and there's beer, too!

link.synopsis: After his sister visits America, a confirmed bachelor decides to change his ways in this hit Polish comedy from first-time director Marek Rebacz. Now, the previously commitment-shy Stasio wants to find a wife, and his friends know just how to snag the &NFi;Playboy&NFi_; bunny he's always dreamed of. Unfortunately for Stasio, newspaper ads for beautiful, sultry prospective wives can yield some surprising results ...

Co Mi Zrobisz Jak Mnie Zlapiesz

link.synopsis: Three dancers at a burlesque house struggle to keep their profession an art form in this colorful musical comedy set in 1954. Pressured by their sleazy manager to show more skin when they perform, the trio bands together in protest, determined not to let him downgrade their dance routines into mere strip shows. Cherilee Taylor's turn as one of the sexy dancers and a cool 1950s rock 'n' roll soundtrack fuel this enticing romp.

link.synopsis: When Kelly Sullivan, the president's young daughter, learns that a children's shelter is about to close, she sets out to save the center  … with the help of her kindly extraterrestrial "uncle." But after the media make her a laughingstock, Kelly splits the scene and soon finds herself in real trouble. Now, only her out-of-this-world friend can  save her. Hailey Foster stars in this cosmic comedy directed by Henri Charr.

link.synopsis: An irreverent reflection on avarice and murder, writer-director Raoul Ruiz's sharp black comedy explores the thin line between insight and insanity. When delusional heiress Livia (Elsa Zylberstein) meets escaped serial killer Pointpoirot (Bernard Giraudeau), the two form an unlikely bond. Soon, Pointpoirot is helping Livia dispose of her absurdly greedy family. A festival circuit favorite, the film was nominated for the Palme d'Or at Cannes.
link.title: synopsis
The Most Terrible Time in My Life
The Hypothesis of the Stolen Painting / The Suspended Vocation

link.synopsis: A boozing writer living in suburbia decides -- at age 30 -- that it might finally be time to end his extended adolescence and make some changes to his frat boy lifestyle. But once he loses the all-night binges, slacker roommates, puerile male bonding, angry exes and glad-handing strippers, what's left? Joseph Egender, Samuel Child, Ari Zagaris and Buffy Charlet co-star in this dark indie comedy from writer-director Mitchell Altieri.
link.title: synopsis
The Way I Spent the End of the World

link.synopsis: In this live performance filmed at New York's Town Hall in February 2005, Billy Connolly delivers the outrageous brand of comedy that's sustained his successful stand-up career for more than 30 years. With a huge international fan base, the hilarious Connolly releases his brazen observational humor with shocking honesty and Scottish flair in the Big Apple. This marks his first filmed concert in America.

link.synopsis: With her daughter's wedding around the corner, Margaret Becker Hix (Rue McClanahan) must endure the onslaught of family drama with fortitude in this charming comedy of closely gathered generations. Director Charles Correll delivers the third installment of the lighthearted series with a homespun familiarity and vivid glimpse into the world of family weddings. Kristy McNichol, Ted Shackelford and Brett Cullen co-star.

link.synopsis: In his directorial debut, Jay Floyd brings us the story of the Franklin family, conservative Christians whose lives are turned upside down (quite literally) in a car accident. After a run-in with Jesus, the Franklins are converted to believers of as much sex as possible, clashing with the fundamentalist views in their Southern community. This black comedy explores issues such as bigotry and sexual repression all while giving you the kicks.

link.synopsis: Copenhagen-born Victor Borge -- "the Clown Prince of Denmark" -- serves up his trademark blend of classical music and clever comedy in these 14 rarely seen episodes of his short-lived TV show. Digitally remastered from recently unearthed 16mm kinescopes, the shows collected here capture Borge at his silliest, often clowning alongside a pre-"Honeymooners" Art Carney, who plays everything from a piano doctor to a painting.

link.synopsis: Not your typical samurai flick, this quirky adventure concerns two flamboyantly gay, down-on-their-luck warriors who journey to a healing shrine to battle heroin addiction. When the titular characters (Tomoya Nagase and Shichinosuke Nakamura) saddle up their Harley to cruise through a fantasy landscape, it's anything goes in this decidedly odd hybrid that's part slapstick comedy, part musical and part Easy Rider-style road flick.
link.title: synopsis
Warriors of the Wasteland / Cosmos: War of the Planets

link.synopsis: Three years have passed since the last installment of this sports comedy epic, and the misfit hockey players of the Les Boys team are ready for another exciting season of hilarity and high jinks. But when coach Stan (Rémy Girard) returns home from a three-year stint in France, he finds his namesake tavern in direct competition with a newfangled sports bar owned by a man with hidden motives. Marc Messier, Patrick Huard and Serge Theriault co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Mark Messier: Leader, Champion and Legend
Big Shot: Confessions of a Campus Bookie
Waking Up Wally: The Walter Gretzky Story

link.synopsis: Tired of living life as the star of the hit television show "Ninja Boy," teenager Kevin Ryan (Ted Jan Roberts) decides to quit and rejoin the "normal" world in this sequel to the 1994 family comedy Magic Kid. But Kevin's cowardly agent -- his uncle Bob (Stephen Furst, who also directs) -- has trouble standing up to the show's director and producers when they make it impossible for Kevin to leave the production and regain his adolescence.
link.title: synopsis
The Tangerine Bear: Home in Time for Christmas!
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain
Tommy Tricker and the Stamp Traveller

link.synopsis: Slyly spoofing his gangster persona in this quirky comedy, Edward G. Robinson stars as Remy Marco, a bootlegger trying to keep his business afloat after Prohibition ends. Trouble is, his foul-tasting beer can't compete in the free market, causing sales to plummet and threatening to put Marco in the poor house. As if that weren't enough, he must also contend with the cops watching his every move -- and four corpses in his vacation home.
link.title: synopsis
You Can't Take It with You
Orson Welles: The Stranger/Orson Welles on Film
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: Robert Mitchum plays a luckless gambler who agrees to sell his identity to a deported mobster (Raymond Burr). Jane Russell co-stars as a singer pretending to be an heiress, in an attempt to get her hooks into a Shakespeare-slinging actor (Vincent Price). These and other shady characters wind up in a Mexican resort, where the fun really begins. Howard Hughes produced this comedy noir as a vehicle for his rising star Russell.
link.title: synopsis
Cinema's Dark Side: Impact/ Second Woman/ They Made Me a Criminal
Portland Expose / They Were So Young
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: I Shot Jesse James

link.synopsis: Before television made Tim Allen a household name, his average guy persona made him a star headliner on the stand-up comedy circuit. His groundbreaking routines crossed the barrier between the sexes, appealing equally to men and women. This hilarious video collects two of his most hysterical concerts, "Men Are Pigs" and "Tim Allen Rewires America." Bonus material includes commentary, an interview with Allen and the brand-new short "Docu-Comic."

Jackie "The Joke Man" Martling: A Safe Distance From Genius

link.synopsis: This brisk comedy follows two friends -- lesbian Kira (Kathleen Fontaine) and straight Sydney (Tara Howley) -- who cope differently with their unrealized personal and professional dreams. Suffering from stage fright that prevents her career from thriving, aspiring comic Kira engages in empty sexual encounters to drown her sorrows. Meanwhile, Sydney, a would-be restaurant critic with a decided lack of interest in sex, turns to food for comfort.
link.title: synopsis
Peach / A Bitter Song / Lavender Limelight
She Likes Girls 4: Tomboys & Tough Girls

link.synopsis: The blind Pyare (Fardeen Khan) and the deaf Mohan (Esha Deol) have mastered their disabilities with each other's help. But now, the inseparable duo faces their greatest challenge: helping each other find true love. Enter Preeti (Amrita Rao) and Priya (Boman Irani), who lead our heroes on a song-filled quest for romance in this light Bollywood musical comedy, which features the memorable tagline: Love is blind ... and deaf, too.
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: A reclusive sculptor (Naseeruddin Shah) presides over a Parsi family full of secrets and lies. But when a charming stranger named Cyrus (Saif Ali Khan) becomes a houseguest, the family's skeletons start falling out of the closet. Part thriller, comedy and family drama, this quiet film from writer and first-time director Homi Adajania is a far cry from conventional Bollywood fare though it stars some of the biggest names in the business.
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come
The Most Terrible Time in My Life

link.synopsis: When a big-time banker disappears with a whole passel of cash, his loyal wife, Juana (Veronica Forque), defends her husband's good name against charges of embezzlement -- until she learns the scoundrel was cheating on her. Writer-director Mario Camus's offbeat comedy lightheartedly turns the hard-boiled noir thriller genre on its head while at the same time spinning a twisty story that stays true to the form's conventions.
link.title: synopsis
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?

link.synopsis: An injury sidelines a star goalie in a key minor league soccer match, and the town loser Fernando (Fernando Tejero) must fill in. Luckily, a penalty delays the game's conclusion for one week, giving our hero some extra time to train. The town waits in agony, hoping against hope that Fernando will somehow block the titular "Longest Penalty Kick in the World." This underdog comedy earned a Best Screenplay nomination at Spain's Goya Awards in 2006.

link.synopsis: Prudish prosecutor of all erotic expression, Mr. Rose (Hermie Rose) leads a full-time campaign and mission to exterminate sins of the flesh. But when his own desires and fantasies are awakened from within, the sexual teetotaler loses control in a cyclone of lust and temptation. Now, the moral utopia that Mr. Rose had once imagined stands threatened by carnal pleasures in this 1964 erotic comedy directed by Nick Millard.

link.synopsis: Bumbling beginners at the art of con, Londoners Archie and Hermie stumble upon a briefcase that belonged to a murdered Soviet agent containing secret documents, credit cards and plans for world domination. Thinking they've hit the jackpot, the duo indulges in the high life on stolen credit, eventually hopscotching to America with a beautiful blonde in tow -- and the KGB hot on their tail in this screwball comedy thriller.

This best-of anthology collects six classic episodes with appearances from guest stars Jon Voight, Adrienne Barbeau, Ethel Merman, Ruth Buzzi, Robert Vaughn and Michele Lee.

link.synopsis: Derek Nimmo plays stumbling, bumbling Brother Dominic, a novice monk at Mountacres Priory who's constantly on the verge of expulsion in this BBC comedy series that debuted in 1968. Directed by Harold Snoad, the series -- which ran for three seasons -- also stars Felix Aylmer (as the kindly Father Anselm), Derek Francis and Colin Gordon. All eight surviving episodes are included on this disc.

link.synopsis: In this film festival favorite from Chile, the contrast between what goes on behind closed doors and what's acceptable in a rigidly Catholic society is illuminated as parents grapple with teaching their kids about sex. Focusing on three couples unhinged by their erotic passions, this ribald comedy touches on teenage sex, masturbation and homosexuality -- all taboo topics in Chile -- to hilarious (and sometimes poignant) effect.

link.synopsis: After Ellen DeGeneres's first sitcom -- which broke stereotypes and turned her into a gender politics heavyweight -- ended amid tons of hype and controversy, the comic hid out. That exile ended with her return to television with this comedy. The ever-goofy DeGeneres plays an Internet exec who's forced to move in with her mother (Cloris Leachman) after her business flames out, leaving her to deal with her past with hilarious aplomb.

Abercrombie (George Barbier), whose political aspirations depend on Austin's guilt.

link.synopsis: Directed by John Ford, this comedy features Will Rogers in his final film role, playing a steamboat captain who tries to clear his relative's name. When his nephew (John McGuire) is accused of attacking a young woman (Anne Shirley), riverboat skipper John Pearly (Rogers) must come up with proof of his innocence. Pearly's quest ends in a thrilling steamboat race in which the captain is forced to use his own boat as fuel. Irvin S. Cobb co-stars.

When things heat up between the sparring Martingale family and the Shattuck brood, Steve Tapley (Rogers) jumps in to help Nancy Martingale (Dorothy Wilson) and her grandpa (Charles Sellon). Odds against them, Tapley and the Martingales agree to a decisive horse race against the Shattucks.

link.synopsis: Daniel Galo, Luis Felipe Tovar, Mario Bezares and Victor Hugo Arana co-star as a group of Mexico City urbanites seeking shelter from the storm in this modern-day retelling of the Bible's great flood. Mexican director Eduardo Barraza helms an unconventional mix of comedy and drama, which won acclaim on the international film festival circuit and earned a rep as an audience favorite.

Spiritual Exercises: 10 Films by Olivier Smolders

link.synopsis: Walter Burton (Bob Newhart) is running through his midlife crisis -- literally, after he meets Barrie (Leigh Taylor-Young), a sexy marathoner on a morning run. Captivated, Walter neglects his job and family as he decides to train for the New York City race just to keep pace alongside the alluring young jogger. Newhart's likable charm as the middle-aged marathon man provides the foundation of this lighthearted comedy directed by Jackie Cooper.
link.title: synopsis
The Charge of the Model T's
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Hoping to gain favor with pretty sorority sisters, fraternity brothers Jeff (Mantan Moreland) and his pesky pal Frankie (Frankie Darro) promise to bring rowing phenom Bob Terry to the girls' next dance. But when Bob is unexpectedly drafted, the comic duo must hire an impersonator to cover the blunder -- until they realize that he happens to be a wanted criminal. Also starring Gale Storm, this madcap musical comedy will have you in stitches.

Anything for a Thrill / Men of Action

link.synopsis: Best friends Tina (Eugene Domingo) and Lea (Pokwang) vow to unite their families through marriage. Their dreams come true when they force their children (Sandara Park and Joseph Bitangcol) to marry, even though the newlyweds hate each other. But love takes a few strange twists, and the pushy moms are in for one wild ride. This exuberant comedy also celebrates Vilma Santos's amazing career by cleverly working clips of the star into the narrative.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: Siblings swap gender roles in this contemporary Filipino comedy that follows the antics of a family forced to work for a living while the wealthy people they serve enjoy the good life. When her father's health prevents him from chauffeuring a tycoon's son, tomboyish Luisa (Lolita Rodriguez) dons a disguise and agrees to stand in for her dad. Meanwhile, her effete brother, Gorio (played by Dolphy), runs away and gets mistaken for a girl.
link.title: synopsis
Tad: Busted Circuits and Ringing Ears

link.synopsis: Gujarati-born Ketan Shah (Anupam Kher) and Punjabi-born Baldev Singh (Gursewak Mann) try to make it big in America in this touching comedy that offers a glimpse of what life is like in the States for Indian immigrants. After years of low-paying jobs, Ketan and Baldev start a business together in hopes of finding success in their adopted country, but cultural conflicts come into play as they try to build better lives for themselves.
link.title: synopsis
Dulhan Wahi Jo Piya Man Bhaaye

link.synopsis: Deepak Tijori's comedy centers on three pals whose friendship unravels when they fall for the same girl (Celina Jaitley). Together, they've always been an odd, if closely connected, crew: Tom (Dino Morea) can't hear, Dick (Anuj Sawhney) can't see and Harry (Jimmy Shergill) can't speak. Nothing's ever come between them until now, though they'll soon discover that what they each think they want winds up being nowhere close to what they need.
link.title: synopsis
Mission Istaanbul: Darr Ke Aagey Jeet Hai

link.synopsis: Misunderstood by their families, buddies Boy (Bayani Agbayani) and Andoy (Vhong Navarro) run away to start a new life and end up switching places with a pair of look-alikes in this comedy. Just as the two pals make their getaway, twins Mao and Dao (Agbayani and Navarro) flee their city to escape arranged marriages. A mix-up results in Boy and Andoy impersonating Mao and Dao and vice versa, and it's sheer chaos when one set decides to return home.
link.title: synopsis
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: Fred Astaire is a dancin' fool for love in this Oscar-nominated musical comedy about trumpet-playing pals who compete for the affections of a beautiful woman. Musician buddies Danny (Astaire) and Hank (Burgess Meredith) follow their friend Ellen (Paulette Goddard) to New York City when she's hired as Artie Shaw's band manager. A string of comical mishaps ensues as Danny and Hank try to land spots in the band -- and to win Ellen's heart.
link.title: synopsis

Wayans also served as executive producer for the show.

Girl-crazy Neil and his quirky mates hit the pubs, but the English summer really heats up when the guys host a wild party that winds up affecting their entire lives. Director Hao Ning's charming comedy -- filled with wonder and discovery -- transports viewers to the eternal landscape of the endless steppe.

link.synopsis: Benny Benowitz stars as Karl Peckham, a vaudeville comedian whose offstage life is just as raucous as his performances, in this hilarious comedy. For starters, he just can't seem to stay committed to one woman but claims he can't find love. What he fails to realize is that perhaps the problem lies not with love itself but his take on it. Will Karl see the error of his ways and finally find happiness? And who will make him an honest man?

link.synopsis: It's love at first sight when Vikram (Aarnav Bhatia) meets Neha, but their path to the altar takes a few unexpected turns in this entertaining Bollywood comedy. Though the lovebirds want to marry right away, Neha's father (Satish Shah) insists that unemployed Vikram find a job before a wedding can take place. Will Vikram accept when potential boss Armaan Kochar (Rishi Kapoor) offers him a post ... provided that Kochar gets to sleep with Neha?

link.synopsis: Actresses Liz (Bibi Andersson), Marianne (Harriet Andersson) and Gunilla (Gunnel Lindblom) discover uncanny parallels between their lives and characters they portray on stage in Aristophanes' timeless comedy "Lysistrata." As members of a touring production, each must face her challenges -- including unfaithful spouses and commitment-shy lovers -- and admit that whether the setting is ancient Greece or modern-day Sweden, some things never change.

Riffing on platform shoes and pet rocks, dashikis and bell-bottoms -- and, of course, the ubiquitous Afro -- Sinbad skewers the styles and trends of that colorful decade. Don't forget to wear your go-go boots and love beads to this hilarious concert.
